title: (x) skinny slab serif in Modern Painters magazine - Lubalin Graph {Alex B}
content:
[http://www.modernpainters.co.uk/images/home\_mainLeft.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134345/http:/www.modernpainters.co.uk/images/home_mainLeft.jpg "http://www.modernpainters.co.uk/images/home\_mainLeft.jpg")

Anyone recognize this one? Looking at that R, I think “Avant Garde with serifs” but I don’t believe such a thing exists; pls help & thx in advance!

Best, R

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134345im_/http:/typophile.com/files/home_mainLeft_4545.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Rearrangements and Neighboring Group Effects - Perpetua {Jan Erdmann, Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134345/http:/typophile.com/node/33272 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Philips "Let's make things better" script - hand lettered {Paul Hunt} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134345/http:/typophile.com/node/31952 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roquestrew

comments.content:
The name is lubalin graph, and was designed to be the serif counterpart to avant garde.  
.........................................................

wow, that is brilliant; thanks everyone
